1.text: For the rest, my brethren, rejoice in [the] Lord: to write the same things to you, to me [is] not irksome, and for you safe.

2.text: See to dogs, see to evil workmen, see to the concision.

3.text: For we are the circumcision, who worship by [the] Spirit of God, and boast in Christ Jesus, and do not trust in flesh.

4.text: Though I have [my] trust even in flesh; if any other think to trust in flesh, I rather:

5.text: as to circumcision, [I received it] the eighth day; of [the] race of Israel, of [the] tribe of Benjamin, Hebrew of Hebrews; as to [the] law, a Pharisee;

6.text: as to zeal, persecuting the assembly; as to righteousness which [is] in [the] law, found blameless;

7.text: but what things were gain to me these I counted, on account of Christ, loss.

8.text: But surely I count also all things to be loss on account of the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, on account of whom I have suffered the loss of all, and count them to be filth, that I may gain Christ;

9.text: and that I may be found in him, not having my righteousness, which [would be] on the principle of law, but that which is by faith of Christ, the righteousness which [is] of God through faith,

10.text: to know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, being conformed to his death,

11.text: if any way I arrive at the resurrection from among [the] dead.

12.text: Not that I have already obtained [the prize], or am already perfected; but I pursue, if also I may get possession [of it], seeing that also I have been taken possession of by Christ [Jesus].

13.text: Brethren, I do not count to have got possession myself; but one thingâ€”forgetting the things behind, and stretching out to the things before,

14.text: I pursue, [looking] towards [the] goal, for the prize of the calling on high of God in Christ Jesus.

15.text: As many therefore as [are] perfect, let us be thus minded; and if ye are any otherwise minded, this also God shall reveal to you.

16.text: But whereto we have attained, [let us] walk in the same steps.

17.text: Be imitators [all] together of me, brethren, and fix your eyes on those walking thus as you have us for a model;

18.text: (for many walk of whom I have told you often, and now tell you even weeping, that they [are] the enemies of the cross of Christ:

19.text: whose end [is] destruction, whose god [is] the belly, and [their] glory in their shame, who mind earthly things:)

20.text: for our commonwealth has its existence in [the] heavens, from which also we await the Lord Jesus Christ [as] Saviour,

21.text: who shall transform our body of humiliation into conformity to his body of glory, according to the working of [the] power which he has even to subdue all things to himself.
